headline: Calls for a Democratic gubernatorial debate before the May primary might be answered
sentences: Last month, Cranley called on Whaley to accept a debate at the Columbus Metropolitan Club, noting that at this point of the gubernatorial campaign in 2018, there had already been one.
Former Dayton Mayor Nan Whaley says she will agree to debate her Democratic opponent, ex-Cincinnati Mayor John Cranley, before the May primary.
We are just going to wait until after the filing deadline, which is next week, to start those negotiations," Whaley said.
Republican gubernorial candidates Jim Renacci and Joe Blystone have also called on incumbent governor Gov.
But she says she won't plan any debates until after the Feb. 2 filing deadline.
“I’m happy to debate ,and I know we will debate.
To see more, visit The Statehouse News Bureau.
